inn1.comm: starts off with a fuller delivery outside off that holds its line, left alone
thinks of freeing his arms at the sight of some width outside off, but it moves away just a tad little late and Charles withdraws his bat
good length ball on the stumps, Charles waits in the crease and blocks into the off side
fuller and angling, straightening just a little late, defended back to the bowler
length ball that is angling, Charles dabs it to the leg side, just wide of midwicket for the first runs of the day
fuller ball a set of stumps outside off, just a little bit of swing away, left alone
starts off with a good length ball that is tucked with the angle to midwicket
back of a length that is fired on the leg stump channel, tucked with the angle off the pads to deep fine leg
straight and on the off stump, Brathwaite stays on the backfoot but it's a tad fuller and he gets an inside edge as he brings his bat down, the ball rolls away to backward square leg
short of a length outside off, Brathwaite rocks back to ride the bounce before blocking
short of good length ball around off, Brathwaite jumps back and shuffles across to protect the off stump before defending it down the pitch
fuller ball outside off, gets forward and punches it through the gap at covers. The ball is pulled back before it can reach the boundary but the batsmen have enough time to come back for the third
good length ball that is angled in and shapes away sharply after landing, left alone outside off
short of good length outside off, defended to covers
length ball angling in on off and middle, Brathwaite tucks it to short midwicket
slightly back of a length outside off, Brathwaite shuffles across and the ball keeps a tad low but he manages to keep it out to the covers region
pitches it up on the fourth-stump channel and gets it to move away sharply, Brathwaite doesn't bother going after it
short of good length ball, holding its line outside off this time, Brathwaite jumps back and blocks

poor choice of stroke from Charles. It's an ill-advised slog from way outside off. It was around a set of stumps outside off which means he had to fetch that from way outside off. Gets a thick leading edge for his troubles that lobs towards third man where Kusal Perera nicely settles under it
good length around off, drops it just wide of mid-on and takes off for a quick single
width on offer outside off, Lewis cuts but can't beat the infield
short of a length on middle and leg, doesn't get any movement and it is comfortably tucked off the hips to backward square leg
left alone in the channel outside off

short of a length, holding its line outside off, Lewis slaps it nicely off the backfoot and gets it between cover and mid-off. The outfield isn't as quick, however, and mid-off manages to chase it down and pull it back

oh, beautiful shot. It was overpitched outside off and asking to be hit. Brathwaite takes a good stride across and creams it through extra cover. Didn't try to hit it too hard and there is no great follow-through of the bat. But it was timed perfectly and leaned into it, so used his body weight to good effect to get some power into that stroke
sprays it down the pads and Brathwaite wears it on the pad as the ball races down to the fine leg fence
sprays it down the leg side, Brathwaite tries to glance but makes no contact
good length ball, left alone in the channel outside off
back of a length ball just outside off, rides the bounce before bunting it off the backfoot
sprays it down the leg side again. It was on a length and Brathwaite momentarily thinks of getting outside the line of the ball and tucking but lets it go eventually
angling in on the leg stump channel again, Brathwaite nudges it to the leg side
back of a length outside off, taps it to the off side off the backfoot
length ball on the leg stump channel, flicked off the pads but straight to square leg
short of a length outside off, holding its line, Lewis looks to shuffle across and punch it through the off side but gets an inside edge and the ball goes to mid-on
back of a length outside off, moves across and gets on top of it before punching off the middle of the bat this time, but finds cover
back of a length, pushed across, Lewis punches it between cover and point but doesn't middle and there is hardly any momentum on the ball as it is easily fielded
back of a length and angling in to the pads, tucked behind square
shuffles across early to cover his off stump, Lakmal fires a good length ball that is pushed across and goes from close to off on its way to the wicketkeeper. Well-judged leave
short of a length ball that moves away a little. Brathwaite closes the face of his bat as he tries to flick to the leg side and gets it off a thin leading edge to the off side
runs it down to third man for a single
short of a length outside off, moves across to cover the off stump and defends it back to the bowler
good length, holding its line after landing on the fourth or fifth stump line, gets across and defends into the off side with bat close to pad
yorker on the stumps, Lewis is equal to the task and squeezes it out as he jams his bat down and the ball goes down the pitch before it is fielded at mid-on

appeal for lbw, turned down. It was a good length ball and Lewis looked to flick it to the leg side against the angle. He misses and the ball hits him quite high on the pad, probably got an inside edge there too
back of a length ball outside off, defended to point
good length ball outside off, Brathwaite is slightly caught between the front foot and backfoot but manages to work it back to the bowler
persists with the outside off channel and sends down another length ball. It slightly gets back in late and Brathwaite gets an inside edge on to the pads. Not much feet there either
tucked to backward square leg
good length ball on the fourth-fifth stump channel, holds its line, Brathwaite gets nicely behind it and punches it back to the bowler
fuller outside off, comes forward and blocks it quietly into the covers area where short extra cover dives to stop the ball
good length ball that is pushed across and holding its line outside off, punched from the crease to covers
good length ball, moving away, left alone
short of good length ball, tucks it to the leg side
good length ball, pushed across pretty close to off stump, but Lewis is sure of his off stump and trusts the bounce to shuffle across and lift his bat
moves across the stumps early and tries to flick it to the leg side but ends up wearing it on the pads. Height was certainly an issue there
short of a length outside off, punched to covers
straight length ball just outside off, defended back to the bowler
length ball around off, Brathwaite gets his defensive stroke off the inside part of the bat to the leg side
short of a length ball outside off, uses his wrists to tuck it to midwicket
short of a length outside off, works it to mid-on

that's a freak run out. Brathwaite's bat gets stuck in the turf and there is a direct hit at the non-striker's end. Coming to the delivery, it was slightly back of a length ball that keeps a tad low outside off. Brathwaite manages to make the adjustment and nudges it to mid-on before taking off for a single. He runs across a bit casually and Kulasekara picks up the ball and nails a direct hit. Unfortunately for Brathwaite, though he realised that he has to hurry and got his bat down, it gets stuck in the turf and his feet are in the air as the bails come off
comes forward to this good length ball and defends it to the off side
beaten! It was a seam-up ball. Short of a length and Hope is neither on the front foot nor on the backfoot. Gets stuck in the crease and sticks his bat out and the ball shoots past the outside edge
full ball and on the pads, brings the wrists into play and clips off the pads through long-on
back of a length ball, bangs it in on top of the stumps, blocked into the off side
short of a length and angling in, tucked off the pads through square leg
nudged with the inward angle just wide of mid-on for a single
short of a length on the stumps, blocked to mid-on
back of a length and angling, tucked off the pads behind square
good length, pushed across outside off, Lewis shuffles across and defends to short midwicket

edged and put down! That was what Kulasekara was looking to do. Takes it away from the good length region. Finds the outside edge and Dickwella dives across but spills it. He dived in front of first slip but that was still comfortably his catch
short of a length outside off, gets his foot across and drills it through extra cover
suffles across to cover his stumps before drilling this fuller ball to short extra cover

wild swing outside off and gets an outside edge that flies down to third man. Pradeep gives him some width and tempts him to open up his arms which Hope does, but the ball goes well wide of the cordon and races away to the third man boundary
late away movement outside off, left alone
good length ball, moves across and defends to covers
good length ball, movement off the seam there as it jags back in and results in an inside-edge on the attempted flick
length ball around off, holding its line this time and Hope defends it into the off side
short of a length ball, jumps back to ride the bounce and blocks into the off side
width on offer outside off, Lewis slaps it away to sweeper cover, didn't bounce as much as he would have liked
short of a length ball, nudges it with the inward angle to mid-on
fuller ball, a set of stumps outside off, comes forward and defends it into the off side
very full ball outside off, leans forward and drives straight to mid-off
very full and on the stumps, comes forward and drives slightly uppishly towards mid-off where Upul Tharanga dives to his left to cut it off
good length ball attacking the stumps, defended off the front foot to mid-off
some flight on off, no turn. Lewis wants to drill this down the ground with hard hands. The ball skews away to deep point
flat outside off, Hope goes right across and pats the ball towards point for one.
short and slightly wide outside off, Lewis hammers his cut to deep point. Muscular stroke
nudged towards point again. Hope wants one, Lewis doesn't. Hope is sent back. A direct hit from slip, running towards point, breaks a stump at the batsman's end. A new one comes out
nice pace. Full but slow with a bit of drift. Worked to midwicket
clipped towards midwicket
short of a length on the leg stump channel, Lewis looks to get outside of the line of the ball and tuck it off the hips but doesn't get bat to ball
shuffles across before steering this back of a length ball down to third man
fuller ball, drills it to mid-off before taking off for a quick single
full and drifting away, nice line that, Lewis moves across before shouldering arms
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
fuller ball outside off, leans forward and drives but straight to short cover
good length ball that holds up a little, Hope checks the drive and the ball goes uppishly before landing in front of cover
fuller ball, works it wide of cover
very full ball outside off, drilled to mid-off
good length ball, spinning back in slightly, punches off the backfoot to long-on
flatter and short of a length, slapped off the backfoot to sweeper cover
loopy flighted ball on middle and leg, Hope heaves it towards long-on and the ball goes on the bounce to the fielder
short and wide, uses the width to slap it square of the wicket before sweeper cover runs across and stops it
short and wide outside off, doesn't get up as much, slapped away square of the wicket
fuller ball just outside off, comes forward and presents the full face of his bat as the ball goes to mid-on
short of a length and moving away outside off, Hope runs it down to third man
short ball, ducked under
back of a length and pushed across, chops the attempted cut
short of a length ball, Lewis tries to flick it but gets a thin leading edge and the ball goes on the bounce to the bowler
flighted just outside off and lands on a length, punched off the backfoot to the right of the bowler
pitches it up on the stumps, comes forward and eases it down to long-on
flighted outside off, Lewis drills it hard through the covers, threw everything at it and went hard but an equally good stop by the fielder in the deep, just around the sweeper cover fence
flatter length ball outside off, punched off the backfoot towards mid-on, the bowler dives to his right to field the ball

that is just drilled through the off side. It was flighted and Hope gave himself just enough room to drive through the covers region. Gets it wide of sweeper cover who can't get to it despite putting in the dive
back of a length from around the wicket and pushed across the left-hander, punched to the off side
tries to make some room and punches but picks out mid-off
tucked to midwicket
nudged behind square
pushed through quicker, 84kph, full on the stumps, defended down the pitch to the right of the bowler
punched off the backfoot to the right of the bowler who dives but can't stop it, the ball goes down to long-on
flatter and on off stump, waits for it before turning it away to the leg side
gives it a little more air outside off, Hope comes forward and drills it to point
drags the length back slightly this time, not much turn and Hope punches off the backfoot to long-on
short of a length, Lewis is pushed to the backfoot and sticks his bat out from far away, the ball spins away sharply and Lewis is beaten
eased down to long-off
tucked to midwicket
flighted on off and middle, defends on the front foot and gets an inside edge
gives it a lot of air and gets it loopily outside off, Hope drives it to sweeper cover
creates some room for himself before punching off the backfoot through extra cover. Sweeper cover runs across and gets around the ball

tucked to midwicket and takes off for a quick single. The fielder there has a shy at the striker's end and Dickwella fails to collect the ball cleanly, perhaps expecting it to bounce more than he anticipated and ends up conceding the overthrow
nudged to midwicket
defended down the pitch off the front foot
very slow offcutter, on a length outside off, 84 kph, punched off the backfoot to mid-on who makes a diving save
stays back to this length ball outside off and nudges it to the leg side
fuller ball, comes forward and squeezes it out to point
fires it down the leg side, Hope tries to get outside the line and tuck off the pads but can't put bat to ball and wears it on the pad instead
fuller ball outside off, clipped to short midwicket

oh, is that a stumping! He's given out caught behind actually. Got into a tangle by coming down the track. It was pushed through fuller and Lewis comes down the track. But there is a lack of flight and Lewis is undone by the nice drift. Gets an outside edge as he looks to go through the off side which is snaffled by the wicketkeeper. Had the ball not brushed the edge, he would have been stumped
fuller ball that is pushed across in that probing line outside off, defended off the front foot down the pitch
pitched up outside off, comes forward and drives but straight to short cover
full toss, eased down to long-on
good length ball, stays on the backfoot and plays for the turn. The ball straightens and he keeps it out to the off side
flighted and pitched up on middle and leg defended on the front foot into the off side
a nice and full offcutter outside off, Carter leaves. Good take from Dickwella, followed the ball
short on off, terrible delivery. Swatted to deep midwicket. Carter should have done more with that
fuller this time on off, worked to midwicket
short again, hurries onto Hope who pulls to midwicket. Too many dot balls from WI
90 ks, an offcutter on leg. Hope misses his flick and is struck on the body. The ball almost trickles back
fuller length outside off, pushed back. Another dot
short of a length ball, backs away to play for the turn, cut square of the wicket
flighted, loopy ball that is on leg stump, looks to whip it away to the leg side but gets an inside edge to the pad
punched off the backfoot to covers
back of a length, blocked into the off side off the backfoot
flighted ball that is angled in, comes down the track to take it on the full before driving square of the wicket. Point makes a diving save, so there is no run
driven through covers
very slow off-cutter outside off, 88 kph, tucked off the hips to deep midwicket
fuller and on the fourth stump channel, comes forward and pushes it gently into the off side
lot of width on offer this time, looks to get back and cut but finds point
stays back and looks to tuck this length ball to the leg side but it stays low and he gets a leading edge that goes to point
defended back to the bowler
shifts on to the backfoot before nudging this length ball to the leg side
pitched up outside off, eased down to long-on
flatter back of a length ball, tucked to short fin leg
pitched up, clipped off the toes behind square on the leg side
flat and short outside off, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
tucked to square leg off the backfoot. Five singles off five balls so far this over
comes forward to defend this good length ball and gets it off the inside part of the bat
very slow length ball outside off, 91 kph, punched off the backfoot to midwicket
width on offer and Carter capitalises. It was short and enough room for Carter to free his arms, slaps it wide of deep backward point for a welcome boundary, after 56 balls
stays on the backfoot but it was a bit full and keeps low. Fortunately for Carter, it was outside off, so he was in no real danger and manages to get his bat down and keep it out
appeal lbw, turned down. It was back of a length on leg and middle. Carter looks to flick it but misses and is struck on the pad. Hit quite high
short ball and no pace on it, just 87 kph. Carter gets in position early and muscles a pull. Hit very hard but straight to deep midwicket

shot! That's a humongous hit down the ground. It was pitched up and well outside off which gave Carter enough room to free his arms. Picks it up and whacks it very straight. Gets some serious elevation and it's a clean hit
driven to long-on
pushed through quicker into the right-hander at 88 kph, advances down the ground to take it on the full and uses the pace on that delivery to ease it down to long-on
nudged to the leg side
tucked behind square to short fine leg
runs it wide of short third man for a brace. Big over for West Indies and a much-needed one
slow off-cutter at a short of a length, punched to long-on
short of a length outside off, drops it almost in front of his boot off the backfoot
very full ball on the stumps, squeezed out down the ground and Gunaratne gets down to his right and stops it
very full ball outside off, drilled to long-on
fuller ball on middle and leg, flicks it off the toes but doesn't find the gap as midwicket cuts it off
uses his wrists to flick this length ball but again to midwicket
back of a length outside off, defended to point
beaten. It was short of a length and moving away and Carter gets beaten as he pokes without feet
wide outside off, Carter thinks of going after it but withdraws his bat after changing his mind late. Makes it look like a tentative poke in the end as the ball shoots past the outside edge
full and outside off, no movement, driven to sweeper cover
good length outside off, fetches it from there and plays a pick-up shot to square leg
short of a length on the stumps, drops it to the vacant midwicket region and takes off for a single even as the bowler runs across on the follow-through to gather the ball
short and wide outside off, cuts and picks out backward point
back of a length ball, shuffles across and looks to tucks it away but can't beat the infield
tucked behind square
fuller ball, gets an inside edge to the pads as he looks to flick and the ball goes to mid-on
keeps low, Hope gets back and tucks it to the leg side
fuller ball, angling, comes down and goes inside-out before driving through extra cover
fires one outside off, the ball goes from beneath the batsman's bat, close call but called a wide by the umpire, much to Pradeep's displeasure

powerful shot down the ground. It was full and just outside off, on the fourth stump channel. Carter gets on top of it and heaves it straight down the ground as the ball goes on the bounce over the straight boundary
tucked to midwicket
full and in the slot for Hope who leans forward and creams it through covers where the fielder puts in the dive but the ball beats him
short of a length and angling, tucked to deep square leg
tries to run it down to third man but gets beaten as it wasn't wide enough, too close to off stump to pull that off
tries to do the same thing again but this one was short of a length and gets up steeply. He is also hurried by pace and makes no contact
back of a length, comes in sharply to cramp Hope as he looks to punch off the back foot. Ends up squirting it to midwicket, defensively
down the track, and this time Asela's inward movement works against him. Hope gets into an excellent position, clearing his front leg to make swinging room, and launches it high over wide long-on
quicker, back of a length, comes into the body and he defends to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, jammed hard into the ground while defending off the back foot and the ball bounces over the leaping bowler, enabling the single
back of a length close to off. Carter lets it come on and dabs to the right of short third man

bowled him! He's bowling an offcutter every ball, and he's getting them to grip and turn like proper offbreaks. Hope is undone by the length and the movement. He makes a small forward press, realises he needs to go on the back foot, and ends up stuck on the crease as it turns in from wide outside off stump, past his feeble attempt to push into the covers
slower ball on middle and off, defended off the front foot
shortish, close to off. Too close to cut and it sneaks past Carter's outside edge
back of a length, looked like an offcutter, moves away slightly with extra, though loopy, bounce, and beats Carter's attempt at dabbing to third man

back of a length, close to off, defends with an open bat face to steer it to the right of backward point. Third man fires in a throw at the bowler's end as they sneak a second, and no one's really backing up, but mid-off manages to clean up
looks for that dab to third man once more, and again he can't put bat to ball. This one was bowled a little slower, and he didn't pick the change of pace
another back-of-a-length ball, close to off stump, shuffles back and across this time to work it into the leg side
length ball close to off, takes all the pace off it. Carter pokes it into the point region to bring Powell on strike for the first time
loopy offcutter wide of off, and Powell stretches out to defend, gets off the mark with an inside-edge that rolls away through square leg
back of a length close to off stump, defended into the off side
shortish, close to off stump, pulled to deep midwicket
back of a length, comes in towards off stump to cramp Powell, who defends into the covers
flighted offcutter outside off. Powell looks to slog-sweep, misses it. Looks like he was through his shot too early
length ball slanting across the left-hander. Stops on him as he comes forward to drive, and he ends up playing it to deep square leg off the inside half of the bat
back of a length, on middle and off, defended into the covers
full, too straight, Powell gets his front pad out of the way and flicks crisply to the midwicket boundary. Lovely timing
back of a length, angling down leg. Looks to clear his front leg and pull that square, but he's through his shot too early and it rolls of his pad into the leg side
back of a length offcutter. Pitches on leg stump and moves towards middle and leg. Looks to work it across the line and the ball hits him on the thigh
length ball on middle stump, not much pace, no room at all. Carter moves his front pad out of the way and plays an inside-out push to point
length ball turning in from wide outside off. Powell waits and pushes to long-on with a straight bat
short outside off, slapped away to the right of cover

tossed up slow on middle stump, it's right in Carter's slot this time, and by now he's used to Asela's pace. Gets down low and slog-sweeps, really quick hands through the ball to hit against the turn, up and over the midwicket boundary

oh, shot. Deep midwicket has gone back now, and he pulls to the fielder there, but the footwork was excellent. Not a short ball at all, but knew Asela's lack of pace would give him time to rock right back into his crease
back of a length, turns in towards middle, defended to midwicket
back of a length, cutting in towards the pads, clipped to the right of midwicket
short of a length and angling, tucked off the hips towards square leg
short , slower ball, pulled from outside off, around shoulder height to deep square leg
steered to backward point, Carter calls for the run and Powell hesitantly obliges but manages to make it safe
back of a length slower ball, shapes up to open the face of his bat and run it down to third man but gets beaten after being cramped for room
fuller ball on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
low full toss on off and middle, whipped away to long-on
slower ball on the leg stump channel, tucked to square leg
short ball, shapes up to pull but the bounce is too steep, more than he anticipated and Powell makes no contact
low full toss, clipped away to midwicket
short of a length, leg-stumpish, tucked off the hips towards deep fine leg. They dart back for a quick second and that is fifty for Carter on his birthday
tucked behind square and they come back quickly for a second as the fielder in the deep has to cover some ground
short of a length, gets on top of it and punches off the backfoot to point

nearly carried to long-on! It was a fuller ball outside off, slanting in with the arm and Powell picks it up and heaves it down the ground. Suranga Lakmal advances and puts in the dive but the ball lands just in front of him after dipping late, escapes to the boundary, but a good effort nonetheless
fuller ball on the stumps, Powell looks to flick it away but closes the bat face early and gets a leading edge
fired too wide outside off and called a wide

Kulasekara hits the blockhole and Powell does well to jam his bat down to drill it back towards the bowler, who gets his hand to it but does not manage to entirely stop it as the ball goes down the pitch
very full ball outside off, driven through extra cover

Fuller ball on the pads and the leg stump channel, Carter flicks it off the pads but does not keep it down. It was a kind of a pick-up shot and the ball, though flat in trajectory, carries all the way to deep square leg
yorker, squeezed out back to the bowler
very slow off-cutter, spins back in like an off-break would have, from back of a length, Brathwaite gets his front pad out of the way and tucks it behind square
bowled on the pads, eased down to wide long-on
very full outside off, uses his wrists and whips it to long-on
length ball outside off, punches it down to long-on, looks for the second but there is no chance of the run and he is rightly sent back by Brathwaite
straight length ball on the stumps, stays in the crease and defends towards mid-on
good length outside off, stays in the crease and waits for it before opening the face of his bat to steer it to backward point. Takes off for a quick, sharp single
full and on middle and leg, drilled down to long-on, Brathwaite wants a second and runs back a few steps but he is sent back by Powell, and rightfully so, there was no second run there

oh, that's huge! That one sits on the roof. It was a harmless full and straight delivery on the stumps. Powell gets his front leg out of the way to give himself enough room to free his arms before having it powerfully over long-on and the ball hits the roof
goes for the yorker but bowls it down the leg side. Powell looks to slog but inside-edges it to the pad before the ball goes to square leg, giving them two

dropped. It was another fuller ball and another heave over the leg side. Powell lofted it down the ground, just to the wide of deep midwicket, where Shehan Jayasuriya runs a few inches to his right and seems to be in control, but drops it. He got right to it, dropped, juggled and again seemed to be taking it before spilling it
tucked to deep midwicket
off-cutter going down leg, Brathwaite shovels it and his bottom-hand comes off as he plays the stroke. The ball goes on the bounce to the left of long leg to the boundary. Not pretty, but effective

that's an enormous strike. It was a short ball and Powell lays into a pull shot. Gives it an absolute whack and clears the deep square leg boundary with ease despite how long the boundary is in that part of the ground
low full toss, clipped to deep midwicket, calls for a second and gets a goo response from Powell

what a shot! that is humongous! It was very full, almost a yorker and Powell picks it up and whacks it over deep midwicket. Takes the front leg out of the way to set it up and it's all muscle thereafter as he slogs it powerfully
full and outside off, drilled very hard down the ground to long-off
takes the pace off after those power hits and bowls it on a length outside off, Powell waits in the crease before opening the face of his bat and steering it to third man

edged and taken! Powell's burst comes to an end with an outside edge against a full ball on the fifth-stump channel. Powell looks to drill it hard through the off side and ends up hitting the ground even as the ball takes the outside edge that is snaffled by the wicketkeeper. Has he done enough damage though?
fuller around off, driven to long-off
drops this length ball outside off in front of point and turns the strike over to give the strike back to Brathwaite
goes for a yorker and Brathwaite squeezes it out. It's drilled, actually, and quite hard, but straight towards Holder who takes a blow on the arm at the non-striker's end
slower ball on the stumps, eased down to long-on
good length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
full and on the pads, clipped to midwicket

short ball does Brathwaite in. It was lack of pace again. Short and angling in and Brathwaite was shaping up for the pull. But that was the legcutter and Brathwaite gets no power on that shot as he hits it straight to short fine leg
Nurse survives the hat-trick. It's full and angling in and Nurse pushes it down to long-on

slower ball that is nudged to midwicket. Holder calls for the single and Kulasekara swoops down, picks the ball up and gets rid of it in a jiffy as he nails the direct hit at the non-striker's end. Holder knew he was gone, didn't even wait for the replays to finish playing
slower back of a length ball, Benn looks to lazily flick it but ends up making no contact and wears it on the pad
short of a length and on the stumps, defended down the pitch
fuller ball on the stumps, driven to mid-on
looks for a yorker and ends up sending a low full toss on middle and off which is driven gently down to long-off
gets the yorker right this time. It's on leg stump channel and Benn uses the angle to nudge it to deep midwicket
full and angling in on middle and leg, presents the full face of the bat and pushes it past the bowler to long-off. Lakmal got down and put his hand out to stop it but doesn't do it cleanly

very well-directed bouncer. Benn makes a pre-meditated move and leaves the crease and backs away. But Lakmal follows him and bangs in a steep bouncer on the leg stump channel and Benn can't do anything about it as he is cramped for room
short of good length on leg stump, pulled to deep square leg

well-bowled again. Benn backs away looking to make room again and Lakmal follows him. This time, he looks for a yorker. Doesn't get it where he would have exactly liked to as it ends up going on the full towards the batsman but Benn can't put bat to ball nonetheless as there is no room
yorker length on leg stump, comes forward and looks to flick but closes the bat face early and gets a leading edge to sweeper cover

low full toss outside off, Benn was backing away but manages to get his bat dow at an angle to steer it towards the square third man fence. The ball beats the fielder who runs across from the drrp and dives
very full ball outside off, Benn is rooted to the crease as he swings wildly looking to slog and misses
very full ball, nearly a yorker, squeezed out back to the bowler

very full ball, Benn was looking to get outside the line of the ball and scoop it behind square on the leg side. But he misses and is struck on the pad. That seems to be in front of off stump and umpire Erasmus raises his finger. Benn decides to take a review and the replays show that the ball would have crashed into middle and off
good length on the stumps, stays in the crease and blocks it solidly back to the bowler
full toss on the stumps, swings hard and gets it behind to deep backward square leg

yorker on off and middle and angling in. It hits Gabriel on the back boot as he tries to jam his bat down and umpire Russell Tiffin takes little time to raise his finger. Replays show the ball would have hit leg stump

inn2.comm: back of a length, angling in from outside off. Looks to work it into the leg side from the crease, inside-edges into his front pad. A bit of extra bounce for Gabriel

good ball, and again Dhananjaya is stuck on the crease, playing across the line. Looks to work a back-of-a-length ball through midwicket, from an off-stump line. The ball stops on him and straightens slightly, and the leading edge pops up dangerously into the cover point region
back of a length, loads of width. Kusal throws his hands at it, looks to carve through point. Ends up toe-ending it to the third man boundary. Had to reach out a really long way
shortish, angling across towards off stump. Kusal makes the mistake of playing across, looking to work through square leg, on the hop, and the ball nips back in and hits his thigh pad
length ball, angling away into a sixth-stump line. Kusal goes for the flat-bat drive without too much footwork, bottom-edges into the pitch
good ball! Back of a length, straightening from a fourth-stump line and bouncing extra to beat Dhananjaya's poke. Didn't really move back and across there, just pushed at it and got opened up
a little bit fuller, along the same line. Dhananjaya leaves this time
back of a length, closer to off stump now, lets it come on and gets on his toes to defend towards point
back of a length, outside off. This time Dhananjaya moves back and across, gets right behind it to defend

good ball, brings it a little closer to off. Again Dhananjaya is stuck on the crease without moving across far enough, and his defensive push rolls down to third man off the outside edge. Got squared up again by a bit of away-seam

ooh, beauty. Angles this across towards off stump, fairly full, and brings it back in off the seam. Kusal drives away from his body, inside-edges it, and the ball flies away inches wide of leg stump, and falls just short of the keeper diving to his right
back of a length, too straight, whipped off the pad to long leg
shortish, not enough width to cut. Kusal plays a controlled chop to the left of backward point
short, closer to off this time, Kusal swivels quickly to pull and Charles dives to his right to stop it at square leg
shortish on middle and off, doesn't get behind it, stays leg-side of the ball and uses his hands and wrists to keep it down into the covers
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
back of a length on middle stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers
gone! Holder gets the breakthrough. Short ball outside off, nips in to cramp de Silva as he tries to pull. Gets an inside-edge and Hope catches it diving to his left
back of a length, on the stumps, defended into the on side
fullish, close to off stump, defends with his bat coming down at an angle, to the man at midwicket
back of a length, close to off. Looks to play towards midwicket, closes his bat face too early and gets a leading edge that rolls to the left of short cover

good ball, extra bounce and a bit of movement in to cramp the left-hander. Was looking to work it square, the ball got big on him and he aborted his shot and let the ball hit him on the body, near the stomach

length ball at a gentle pace, angled across Dickwella, who defends it back to the bowler. He played that from a fourth-stump line. Interesting how different two batsmen can be. Kusal would have stayed leg-side of the same ball and looked to flay it through the covers
back of a length, fifth-stump line, blocked into the covers

on the pads, and that's an awful mix-up! Clips it to square leg, and Kusal takes off at the non-striker's end, unnecessarily. It was hit straight to Charles, who turns, throws at the bowler's end, and hits his target with the batsman a foot short of his crease. Looks like Dickwella took a couple of steps out as well, and then sent his partner back
back of a length close to off, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, blocked into the covers
shot. Fullish on off stump. Plonks his front foot across, but not so far across that it will impede the flow of his bat as he whips this up and over wide mid-on

beauty. On the shorter side of a good length, brings Mendis half-forward to defend, and then curls away late. Mendis played that well, let it go past his outside edge without jabbing at it. More a leave than a case of the ball beating the batsman
short, a bit of width, and Mendis punishes it. Gets on his toes to uppercut over backward point
again that away movement. Starts a little wider outside off, and Mendis can make an earlier decision to leave
back of a length close to off stump, straightens again. Mendis defends nice and late, letting the ball hit his bat and roll down to backward point
good line, fourth-stump, and that late curve away. Mendis leaves confidently

poor shot, and Holder strikes with a clever change of line and length. Fuller, wider, enticed the drive away from the body, and second slip takes the thick edge with two hands, over his head. Should probably not have gone after it considering how consistently Holder was getting the ball to swing away late
back of a length outside off, defended towards point
back of a length close to off, Mendis clips gently to midwicket
shifts his line slightly wider outside off, Dickwella defends it back down the pitch
shortish on off stump, and that's a lovely shot, more a flick than a pull, just steps across, gets on his toes, and sends it rolling away to the square leg boundary

oh my. Pokes at it far from his body, no feet. Good length from Brathwaite, and a good line too, considering Dickwella's tendency to play everything through the on side. Moved it slightly wider outside off, got him to poke, and the thick edge runs away to third man
back of a length on off stump, Tharanga defends back to the bowler
shortish on middle stump, gets on his toes to get on top of the awkward bounce and defend into the leg side
shortish again, leg-stumpish. Dickwella steps across and tucks it off his hip to square leg
too straight, on leg stump this time, Kusal works it away to long leg
good ball, length ball swinging late, angles across initially and comes back in towards middle stump. Tharanga doesn't really get forward, just clips it with the swing, from the crease, to midwicket

oh, excellent bowling. Follows up that full one with a bouncer, must have spotted Tharanga's lack of footwork on the previous ball. Doesn't move his feet now either. Just stands there and ducks awkwardly as it rises over his right ear
short, very wide. Too wide for Tharanga to play a shot
superb stuff from Holder, gets this one to swing into the left hander, back towards his off stump, from a good-length area. Tharanga defends from the crease into the covers
back of a length, fifth-stump line, defended into the covers
fuller this time, and Dickwella welcomes it, and the generous width as well. Slices it up and over the fielder at cover point
bouncer over middle stump. Dickwella steps across it, but can't swivel quickly enough to connect with the hook
short outside off, Dickwella gets back and across and gets too far across to cut, ends up cramping himself and chopping the ball down into the turf off the inside edge
fullish, angling away from off stump, left alone
on the pads this time, clipped quietly to fine leg
shortish, straightens towards middle and leg stump with a bit of that awkward bounce. Dickwella defends towards midwicket
back of a length, swinging narrowly down the leg side. Dickwella steps across and fails to connect with the glance. Good call from the umpire to not call it wide

oh, so close. Gets another short ball to lift more than Dickwella expects as he tries to pull from outside off. Can't quite keep it down, doesn't quite time it, but manages to get it over the man at midwicket

shortish, at Dickwella's body, tucks it off the front ribcage to the left of fine leg. The fielder, Carlos Brathwaite, throws on the bounce to the keeper's end as Dickwella chances a second, and the ball bounces over the leaping keeper
fullish on middle stump, defended to midwicket
shortish, angling across. Dickwella pokes at it outside off, and the extra bounce forces him to edge it, loops up but drops short of backward point
length ball, a bit of width, Tharanga gets forward to slap to point
back of a length close to off. Tharanga seems committed to a forward press, was on the front foot while defending that into the covers
shortens his length a touch and Tharanga's feet are stuck as he tries to dab this to third man. Ends up getting a thickish edge that bounces in front of the one wide slip
back of a length wide of off. Too wide, reckons the umpire after Tharanga leaves it alone
closer to off stump this time, and Tharanga trusts the angle across him and leaves it alone
fuller now, fourth-stump line, Tharanga leaves again
full on off stump, driven back down the pitch, Gabriel may have got his right hand down in time to slow it down. Mid-on fields it moving to his right
back of a length, slightly down leg. Might be a deliberate ploy to try and get Dickwella caught behind down the leg side, given how much he's shuffling across. Tries to glance and misses
shortish, close to off. Jumps across and defends with his bat coming down at an angle - from gully towards wide mid-on - and ends up inside-edging into his pad
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to deep backward square leg
shortish outside off, gets on his toes and flays it away to third man
short on middle stump, steps across and works it to the left of deep backward square leg
ooh, dangerous. Back of a length, too close to off stump to play that angled-bat punch. Was looking to hit that through the covers, ended up inside-edging into the square-leg region
length ball outside off. Looks to drive into the covers but brings too much bottom-hand into it, ends up playing it straighter than he'd like, to the left of the extra-cover fielder
back of a length close to off, defended into the covers
back of a on off stump, steps across and works it to the left of midwicket

ooh, extra bounce from just back of a length, on the stumps. Tharanga's forward press gets him in trouble again. He has to take his bottom hand off to stop the ball from ballooning to point. Hit high on the bat, close to the shoulder
back of a length outside off, steered to third man with an open face
back of a length wide of off. Stops on Dickwella as he looks to slap it through cover. Drags it to mid-off instead, as he meets it further in front of his body that he would have liked
shortish, at the body. He doesn't play a shot at it, raises his bat over his head, lets it hit his hip and roll away to fine leg. Given as leg-byes, I guess because it could count as evasive actrion
shortish, wide of off, slapped to third man
short on off stump. Stops on Dickwella as he shapes to pull. Checks the shot and plays a controlled whip out to deep square leg
shortish on off stump, rises on his toes to defend to short cover
back of a length close to off. Doesn't really get behind the line to defend. Pokes at it with an angled bat and the inside-edge rolls away through square leg
shortish on middle and off. Steps across to work it into the square leg region
starts off with a slow, skiddy back of a length delivery outside off which Dickwell stays in the crease and drops in front of point
short of a length, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover

back of a length on the leg stump channel, tucked off the hips to the backward square leg region, the fielder at deep fine leg runs across and gathers it and a better throw could have had Dickwella in trouble. But it is not so and they easily complete a brace
good length outside off, runs it down to third man
stifled appeal for lbw after Dickwella is rapped on the pads as he misses a flick but it pitched outside leg
fuller ball, pushed down the pitch to the right of the bowler who gets a hand to it
short and wide outside off, too wide, deems the umpire as Tharanga makes no contact on an attempted slap

in the air and falls short of short midwicket. Short ball and Tharanga brings out the pull shot. But he is hurried for pace and probably didn't have sufficient room to execute it properly. The result is a top edge that lobs towards short midwicket but bounces before the fielder can run in and catch
very full ball outside off, squeezed out to sweeper cover

short ball does the trick. It was banged in at some pace - 145.3 kph - and Dickwella, seeing that it's on the channel outside off, looks to lean back and play the ramp shot. Just tried to help it along its way, but hits it straight to Sulieman Benn at third man who settles under it comfortably
good length just outside off, blocked from the crease
short ball outside off, getting up sharply, Gunaratne arches back and lets it go
length ball outside off, strides forward and punches it firmly into the off side
tries to rattle Tharanga with a short ball again, Tharanga pulls to square leg and is in no control of it
back of a length, outside off, arches back and guides it away to third man
banged in outside off and bouncing sharply, left alone
back of a length and angling in, tucked to square leg
short of a length outside off, not much feet from Gunaratne who blocks into the off side
short ball, angling in and bouncing steeply, ducked under
short of a length, in the channel outside off that's teasing the batsman. Tharanga is rooted to the crease as he tries to stick his bat out and guide it towards third man, gets beaten
short ball, aimed at the body in the leg stump channel, Tharanga hurriedly gets his bat down and pulls it away to deep backward square leg
short ball, takes his eyes off as he swivels around and pulls, gets a bottom edge towards fine leg as the wicketkeeper runs back to gather the ball

appeal for lbw but turned down. Mixes the length up cleverly. Tharanga was expecting another short ball and doesn't get his feet forward. It's pitched up on leg stump channel and Tharanga doesn't get his bat down in time as he is beaten by pace but it pitched outside leg stump and would have missed leg as well
short ball that bounces sharply over leg and middle, ducked under
short of a length, tries to tuck it away and gets a slight leading edge as the ball goes back to the right of the bowler
angling in on middle and leg, waits for it in the crease before using the angle to tuck behind square
good length outside off, blocked off the front foot into the off side with bat close to pad
good length on off, comes nicely forward and blocks back down the pitch

edged but doesn't carry to slip. It was short of good length and pushed across, Tharanga tries to hang back and open the face of his bat to run it down to third man. Gets cramped for room and an outside edge but it is very mid and the ball does not carry to slip
short and wide, cuts but chops it towards backward point
short of good length, pushed across, tries to awkwardly fend it off to the leg side from the crease and ends up making no contact
length ball that is on middle and leg, Gunaratne gets across before turning it to the deep fine leg boundary
fuller ball, eased down to long-on
flatter and pushed through quicker on the stumps, blocked
short of a length that spins away and gets up, Tharanga backs away and cuts to point
good length ball that doesn't turn as much, Tharanga was forward playing for the turn but there is a lack of it and he gets an inside edge into the leg side
some turn on that occasion, Tharanga is nicely forward to bunt it
back of a length angling, tucked behind square
good length, angled across, comes forward and defends into covers
swing and a miss. Draws the batsman forward and gets it to nip away late and Tharanga misses the ball as he swings wildly without feet. Tharanga struggling now, 10 off 39
fuller ball, holding its line outside off, comes forward and drives into covers
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
wide ball outside off, no pace, cut to backward point
comes forward and drives it square of the wicket, just wide of backward point, for a quick single
nudged to the leg side

chance of a run out but safe. Tharanga nudges this ball to the leg side and looks for a non-existent single. Gunaratne does not help matters as he sends Tharanga back late after responding initially, but the throw at the striker's end is bad
defended to mid-off off the backfoot

what a soft dismissal! Tharanga will cringe looking at that dismissal for a long time. It was a short ball and Tharanga looks for a pull shot but the ball stops on him and he goes through with the shot early as a result. Gets a leading edge that lobs up towards the bowler and Nurse takes it easily. And that's the end of Tharanga's pained stay
loopy length ball, some turn there, defended off the backfoot
flighted ball, gets on top of it and defends
short and wide, slapped away
flighted ball well outside off, Jayasuriya shuffles across and pads it away
length ball outside off, takes a stride across and tucks it to square leg. Jayasuriya looks for the second run but is denied it
comes forward and defends into the off side
good length, gets up slightly more than anticipated, manages to defend into the off side off the front foot
tucked off the pads to square leg
pitched up outside off, gets neatly across and pushes it to the right of the bowler who fields it
fuller ball, worked to long-on, the fielder at short midwicket dives out of nowhere but the ball gets past him and is fielded at long-on
pushes this flighted ball down to long-on
flighted outside off and spinning in, tucked to midwicket
quicker and flatter, on a length from around the stumps, worked to sweeper cover
eases it down to long-on
short of a length, good bounce on that which helps Gunaratne get on top of that and stand tall before slapping it through extra cover
pitched up on the stumps, comes forward and eases it down to long-on
shuffles across to this length ball outside off, tucked with the turn to square leg
pitched up outside off, comes forward and pushes it past the diving short midwicket fielder to long-on
very full and on the stumps, pushed down to long-on for a comfortable single

It was a pitched up ball around off and Gunaratne comes on to the front foot and flicks expecting it to turn in. But the ball doesn't turn as much, contrary to his expectations and he is struck in front of off. Marais Erasmus has a long, hard look at it before raising his finger. Gunaratne asks for a review, but to no avail as replays show the ball would have crashed into middle and leg. That looked plumb from the moment of impact and Sri Lanka are unravelling here
tries to tuck this length ball off the pads and misses as the ball hits the thigh guard and lobs towards the vacant square leg region. Did he probably get an inside edge?
comes forward and blocks into the off side
defended back to the bowler
defended back to the bowler
comes forward and defends back to the bowler
flighted outside off, drilled hard to mid-off
clipped off the toes to midwicket
pitched up on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
backs away as he shapes for a cut but can't pierce point. Early shout of no

chance, put down at backward point. It was short and wide and Pathirana cut it extremely hard and fails to keep it along the ground as the ball lobs to the right of backward point who dives with his right had outstretched but can't quite hold on to it
pitched up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
very full ball on off and middle, clipped to midwicket
fuller ball, driven to long-off
tucked through midwicket
comes down the track as he looks to flick but wears it on the pad. No appeal for lbw as he was a long way down
punched off the backfoot to long-on
length ball, spinning into the pads, tucked behind square
comes forward and turns it to deep fine leg. Think of the second but decide against it as the fielder fires a throw quickly
blocked down the pitch off the backfoot
pushed through flatter on a good length, tucked off the pads to fine leg
flattish, fairly round-arm, pitches on a good length on middle and off, defended off the front foot
full on leg stump, clipped into the square-leg region
tossed up slow outside off, check-driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, punched to the left of sweeper cover
flat length ball on middle and leg, blocked into the leg side
looped up full, close to off, gets on the front foot to work it with the turn to deep midwicket
shortish, spinning into middle and leg, goes back to work it towards fine leg
back of a length, quicker, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball, turns in towards the pads. Stays back to clip to square leg
down the track to the flighted ball, and Pathirana gets into an excellent position, clearing his front leg to hit with the turn over wide long-on
shortish, too close to off stump to cut, stabbed out gently into the point region
tossed up full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
drops onto a good length close to off, stretches out to push to the right of short cover. Carter moves quickly to cut off the single
back of a length outside off, gets back and across to defend into the covers
length ball, slightly wider, gets forward and pushes into the cover point region. Again Carter scoots to his right to stop the single
quicker, on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, gets on the back foot to play a defensive punch into the covers
floated up wide of off, and that's a good ball. Dips on Pathirana as he stretches out to defend, drops shorter than expected and bounces up high. Gloves it to the left of the keeper
back of a length, flatter this time, makes a bit of room to dab to the right of short third man
goes back to a length ball on the stumps and tucks it with the turn to square leg
tossed up on middle and leg, swept to long leg
length ball turning in towards off stump, shuffles across to work to square leg
floated up outside off, steps across and dabs to short third man with an open face
length ball angling into middle stump, not much turn. Presses forward to tuck it into the square leg region
on the pads, clipped to square leg
floated up slow on off stump, stretches out to defend to short extra cover
a bit quicker but still flighted outside off, defended into the covers
tosses it up and slides down the leg side, gets across to sweep and only manages a bit of glove on it, enough to get it past the keeper and get it running away to the fine leg boundary
angles down leg again. Pitching on leg stump or thereabouts, Jayasuriya gets his front leg a long way across and sweeps powerfully over backward square leg
length ball turning into the pads, clipped through backward square leg

shot. Down the track comes Pathirana again. I think he's been fooled by Benn's armer, but it doesn't matter. Looks to hit over long-on, ends up skewing it over mid-off off the outer half of the bat, still ends up getting six. Cruel game this sometimes is, for bowlers
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
down the track again, not quite to the pitch, pushed to mid-on
another arm ball. Was shaping to sweep, and it came down much quicker and fuller and he had to jam his bat down quickly to keep it out
back of a length, turning in towards middle stump, defended into the leg side
gives it too much air and bowls a full toss which is driven to long-off
shot. It's a flighted ball and drifting in. Pathirana comes charging down the track and makes room for himself before going inside-out through the covers
over-compensates in a bid to cut out the drive and bowls it full on leg stump, Pathirana gets down and sweeps it behind square
fuller ball, looks to go inside-out again but skews it off the inside part of the bat and the ball goes in the air towards long-on but lands safely in front of the fielder there
sees width on offer and brings out the late cut as the ball goes down to third man
tries to flick this length ball to the leg side and gets it on the pad instead
short of a length outside off, stays in the backfoot and opens the face of his bat  to steer it to backward point
good length ball that gets up more than he anticipates. Tries to flick it to the leg side but gets it off the splice. Takes it backhand out immediately, so did it perhaps come off his glove?
short and wide, it bounces a bit steeply so he is not able to really ride the bounce and ends up chopping the cut into the ground
back of a length, angling in to the batsman, quicker and hurrying on to him as Pathirana pulls to midwicket
short ball outside off, good height on that bouncer and Jayasuriya does not bother going after it
short of a length ball, tucked off the hips as he jumps back to the backfoot and the ball is fielded at square leg
pitched up on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
gives it a little bit of air outside off, Jayasuriya presses forward and pushes it into the off side and the ball goes to sweeper cover
full toss, whips it with a flat bat and the ball goes wide of long-on. There was a second run for the taking there, but it needed some quick running. They settle for the single instead
fuller ball, pushed back to the bowler
driven through covers

comes down the track and looks to go big over long-off. It was on a length and Pathirana tries to heave it with the turn. But he gets it off the splice of the bat and gets beaten by the flight too as the ball lobs towards long-off where Lewis settles under it
short and wide, tries to cut and chops it towards covers
short of a length outside off, gets behind it and punches to covers
short of a length outside off, guides it to point
tucked to square leg
back of a length and angling, pulled away to fine leg
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot straight back to the bowler
short and wide ball, tries to stay on his toes on the backfoot and slap it away but it keeps a tad low and he makes no contact

fuller ball angling in, drills it to mid-on and takes off for a quick run. Direct hit and Kulasekara would have been on his way back. That was a suicidal run, but Sri Lanka need to do something with the asking rate creeping and have to take their chances
short ball, the bounce is very steep and Jayasuriya does not make contact on the attempted ramp
pushed back along the ground just wide of mid-on and take off for a quick single, this time they complete it a lot more confortably

short ball, makes a weal attempt at a pull shot but was in no position to play it. There was no room and he ends up ducking slightly even as he tries the stroke. The ball goes through to the wicketkeeper
full and outside off and Jayasuriya opens up his arms at the sight of width. It was in the slot and he is able to stay in the crease and comfortably loft it over long-off

slowr ball, tries to run it down to fine leg but the lack of pace means he is through with the shot early and gets a top edge to the grill of the helmet. Took his eyes off the ball as he played the stroke

a near-yorker goes for a four. It was on the blockhole around off and Jayasuriya drilled it hard down the ground. The ball goes towards long-off where Sulieman Benn gets around it but he does not get down low enough and the ball sneaks through his legs to the boundary. Brathwaite, of course, can't be amused
bouncer, shaoes to pull, too high, so he lets it be

slower ball accounts for Jayasuriya. It was back of a length and Jayasuriya was looking to just tuck it to the leg side for a quick single but he gets a top-edge instead and the ball lobs towards midwicket where it is easily held
low full toss outside off, driven straight to mid-off
short of a length ball, gets up just enough for Kulaskara who pulls it and sends the ball on the bounce to cow corner
nicely done. Short and outside off and Kulasekara jumps up as he uppishly slaps it through point
very full ball, Kulasekara backs away and looks to go over the off side but gets an inside edge and the ball goes behind square

low full toss at 145 kph. Lakmal looks to clip it away to the leg side, but that was extremely quick and he is hurried, ends up getting an inside edge and the ball goes off the pad straight into the stumps
low full toss at 146 clicks, knocked towards mid-off
low full-toss outside off, nearly a yorker, flat-batted to mid-on
full on off stump, and Kulasekara can certainly hit them. Clears his front leg and launches it flat over the bowler's head
back of a length outside off, takes a big step across to punch to the right of deep point
length ball on off stump, clears his front leg and smacks it along the ground to mid-on
shortish on off stump, clears his front leg and plays an inside-out tennis forehand to mid-off
in the blockhole on middle stump, keeps his front foot out of the way and blocks it back to the bowler

full, follows Kulasekara as he steps away from the stumps to make himself room. He shovels this up towards long-on, where Lewis takes an excellent catch to complete victory, running to his right and then tumbling over
